result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Nathan Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott Nathan Howard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott Nathan Howard was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent with 09CF114.
-Defendant is eligible for Boot Camp and Earned Release.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Court suspends Court Costs and DNA surcharge.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Scott Nathan Howard appeared from Jail.  Court called at 2:10 p.m.  Set for SEH.  Attorney make sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  Crt. Orders:

Initial confinement of 5 years with E/S of 5 years concurrent with 09CF114
- 147 days of jail credit
- DE eligible for Boot Camp and Earned Release
 - Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court suspends court costs and the DNA Surcharge
- 20 days to appeal
Revocation summary. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
Sentencing hearing on April 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Scott Nathan Howard appeared from jail.  Court called at 3:10 p.m.  Set for FPT.  Attorney Chapman advises the Court there is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 with the repeater.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 with the repeater.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & Ct. 3.  DE is on probation hold.  Court sets out for SEH.  Court adjourned at 3:21 p.m. lw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on April 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman, DF:  Scott Nathan Howard appeared. Set for a plea however, Atty Chapman requests another dates and believes an agreement is likely. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:   Jennifer Anne Bork   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman, DF:  Scott Nathan Howard appeared from jail.  Court called.  Attorney Chapman advises the court working on a resolution and need to set out for Plea/Sentencing.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG to all 3 counts.  Waives speedy trial.  Bond continues. mab  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Scott Nathan Howard appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:12 p.m. Includes case 15CF07 & 14CM15.  Court  QUASH'S WARRANT in 14CM15.  S/T of Investigator James Haefner of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department.  Direct by ADA Mckinley.  DE is identified by Investigator Haefner.  Cross by Attorney Chapman.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and the DE probably committed it and binds the DE over for trial.  Bail continues.
